column4: Hello, I am cleaning off space on my hard drive to install ubuntu for the first time
i have been spending some time reading up on linux and i have a partitioning question
should i partition anything more than 1 partition and a swap or should i sererate my root etc
what is a recommended partitioning scheme for ubuntu?
the default is fine unless you wish to exercise more control and/or have specific requirements
you could also use wine or cedega to play it in Linux if you have an Nvidia or an ATI graphics card
not kernel-headers-foo, which is what debian uses
i downoaded this file <linux-2.6.8.1.tar.gz> on my windows boot and was going to tar it, is that wrong?
you can just apt-get install linux-source-2.6.8.1
what's preventing you from getting online?
well, since you're online now, you'll find the instructions here: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/support/documentation/howto/ndiswrapper
in particular, scroll down to the bottom of the page and read the post entitled "It's not that hard"
you don't have to compile anything
